intro: Medusagyne, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to certain regions of Africa and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that resemble the shape of a jellyfish. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Medusagyne species are often found in rocky or forested areas, and they produce small, capsule-like fruits. Due to their rarity and specific habitat requirements, these plants are of interest to botanists and conservationists.
